23TQ_OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS_IMPL(JSSynchronizationPrimitive)
24
25std::atomic<JSSynchronizationPrimitive::StateT>*
26JSSynchronizationPrimitive::AtomicStatePtr() {
27 StateT* state_ptr = reinterpret_cast<StateT*>(field_address(kStateOffset));
28 DCHECK(IsAligned(reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(state_ptr), sizeof(StateT)));
29 return base::AsAtomicPtr(state_ptr);
30}
31
32void JSSynchronizationPrimitive::SetNullWaiterQueueHead() {
33#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
34 base::AsAtomic32::Relaxed_Store(waiter_queue_head_handle_location(),
35 kNullExternalPointerHandle);
36#else
37 base::AsAtomicPointer::Relaxed_Store(waiter_queue_head_location(), nullptr);
38#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
39}
40
41#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
42ExternalPointerHandle*
43JSSynchronizationPrimitive::waiter_queue_head_handle_location() const {
44 Address location = field_address(kWaiterQueueHeadOffset);
45 return reinterpret_cast<ExternalPointerHandle*>(location);
46}
47#else
48WaiterQueueNode** JSSynchronizationPrimitive::waiter_queue_head_location()
49 const {
50 Address location = field_address(kWaiterQueueHeadOffset);
51 return reinterpret_cast<WaiterQueueNode**>(location);
52}
53#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
54
55WaiterQueueNode* JSSynchronizationPrimitive::DestructivelyGetWaiterQueueHead(
56 Isolate* requester) {
57 if (V8_UNLIKELY(DEBUG_BOOL)) {
58 StateT state = AtomicStatePtr()->load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
59 DCHECK(IsWaiterQueueLockedField::decode(state));
60 USE(state);
61 }
62#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
63 ExternalPointerHandle handle =
64 base::AsAtomic32::Relaxed_Load(waiter_queue_head_handle_location());
65 if (handle == kNullExternalPointerHandle) return nullptr;
66 // Clear external pointer after decoding as a safeguard, no other thread
67 // should be trying to access though the same non-null handle.
68 WaiterQueueNode* waiter_head = reinterpret_cast<WaiterQueueNode*>(
69 requester->shared_external_pointer_table().Exchange(handle, kNullAddress,
70 kWaiterQueueNodeTag));
71 CHECK_NOT_NULL(waiter_head);
72 return waiter_head;
73#else
74 return base::AsAtomicPointer::Relaxed_Load(waiter_queue_head_location());
75#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
76}
77
78JSSynchronizationPrimitive::StateT
79JSSynchronizationPrimitive::SetWaiterQueueHead(Isolate* requester,
80 WaiterQueueNode* waiter_head,
81 StateT new_state) {
82 if (V8_UNLIKELY(DEBUG_BOOL)) {
83 StateT state = AtomicStatePtr()->load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
84 DCHECK(IsWaiterQueueLockedField::decode(state));
85 USE(state);
86 }
87#if V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
88 if (waiter_head) {
89 new_state = HasWaitersField::update(new_state, true);
90 ExternalPointerHandle handle =
91 base::AsAtomic32::Relaxed_Load(waiter_queue_head_handle_location());
92 ExternalPointerTable& table = requester->shared_external_pointer_table();
93 if (handle == kNullExternalPointerHandle) {
94 handle = table.AllocateAndInitializeEntry(
95 requester->shared_external_pointer_space(),
96 reinterpret_cast<Address>(waiter_head), kWaiterQueueNodeTag);
97 // Use a Release_Store to ensure that the store of the pointer into the
98 // table is not reordered after the store of the handle. Otherwise, other
99 // threads may access an uninitialized table entry and crash.
100 base::AsAtomic32::Release_Store(waiter_queue_head_handle_location(),
101 handle);
102 return new_state;
103 }
104 if (DEBUG_BOOL) {
105 Address old = requester->shared_external_pointer_table().Exchange(
106 handle, reinterpret_cast<Address>(waiter_head), kWaiterQueueNodeTag);
107 DCHECK_EQ(kNullAddress, old);
108 USE(old);
109 } else {
110 requester->shared_external_pointer_table().Set(
111 handle, reinterpret_cast<Address>(waiter_head), kWaiterQueueNodeTag);
112 }
113 } else {
114 new_state = HasWaitersField::update(new_state, false);
115 base::AsAtomic32::Relaxed_Store(waiter_queue_head_handle_location(),
116 kNullExternalPointerHandle);
117 }
118#else
119 new_state = HasWaitersField::update(new_state, waiter_head);
120 base::AsAtomicPointer::Relaxed_Store(waiter_queue_head_location(),
121 waiter_head);
122#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
123 return new_state;
124}
125
126TQ_OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS_IMPL(JSAtomicsMutex)
127
128CAST_ACCESSOR(JSAtomicsMutex)
129
130JSAtomicsMutex::LockGuardBase::LockGuardBase(Isolate* isolate,
131 Handle<JSAtomicsMutex> mutex,
132 bool locked)
133 : isolate_(isolate), mutex_(mutex), locked_(locked) {}
134
135JSAtomicsMutex::LockGuardBase::~LockGuardBase() {
136 if (locked_) mutex_->Unlock(isolate_);
137}
138
139JSAtomicsMutex::LockGuard::LockGuard(Isolate* isolate,
140 Handle<JSAtomicsMutex> mutex,
141 base::Optional<base::TimeDelta> timeout)
142 : LockGuardBase(isolate, mutex,
143 JSAtomicsMutex::Lock(isolate, mutex, timeout)) {}
144
145JSAtomicsMutex::TryLockGuard::TryLockGuard(Isolate* isolate,
146 Handle<JSAtomicsMutex> mutex)
147 : LockGuardBase(isolate, mutex, mutex->TryLock()) {}
148
149// static
150bool JSAtomicsMutex::LockImpl(Isolate* requester, Handle<JSAtomicsMutex> mutex,
151 base::Optional<base::TimeDelta> timeout,
152 LockSlowPathWrapper slow_path_wrapper) {
153 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
154 // First try to lock an uncontended mutex, which should be the common case. If
155 // this fails, then go to the slow path to possibly put the current thread to
156 // sleep.
157 //
158 // The fast path is done using a weak CAS which may fail spuriously on
159 // architectures with load-link/store-conditional instructions.
160 std::atomic<StateT>* state = mutex->AtomicStatePtr();
161 StateT expected = kUnlockedUncontended;
162 bool locked;
163 if (V8_LIKELY(state->compare_exchange_weak(expected, kLockedUncontended,
164 std::memory_order_acquire,
165 std::memory_order_relaxed))) {
166 locked = true;
167 } else {
168 locked = slow_path_wrapper(state);
169 }
170 if (V8_LIKELY(locked)) {
171 mutex->SetCurrentThreadAsOwner();
172 }
173 return locked;
174}
175
176// static
177bool JSAtomicsMutex::Lock(Isolate* requester, Handle<JSAtomicsMutex> mutex,
178 base::Optional<base::TimeDelta> timeout) {
179 return LockImpl(requester, mutex, timeout, [=](std::atomic<StateT>* state) {
180 return LockSlowPath(requester, mutex, state, timeout);
181 });
182}
183
184bool JSAtomicsMutex::TryLock() {
185 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
186 StateT expected = kUnlockedUncontended;
187 if (V8_LIKELY(AtomicStatePtr()->compare_exchange_strong(
188 expected, kLockedUncontended, std::memory_order_acquire,
189 std::memory_order_relaxed))) {
190 SetCurrentThreadAsOwner();
191 return true;
192 }
193 return false;
194}
195
196void JSAtomicsMutex::Unlock(Isolate* requester) {
197 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
198 // First try to unlock an uncontended mutex, which should be the common
199 // case. If this fails, then go to the slow path to wake a waiting thread.
200 //
201 // In contrast to Lock, the fast path is done using a strong CAS which does
202 // not fail spuriously. This simplifies the slow path by guaranteeing that
203 // there is at least one waiter to be notified.
204 DCHECK(IsCurrentThreadOwner());
205 ClearOwnerThread();
206 std::atomic<StateT>* state = AtomicStatePtr();
207 StateT expected = kLockedUncontended;
208 if (V8_LIKELY(state->compare_exchange_strong(expected, kUnlockedUncontended,
209 std::memory_order_release,
210 std::memory_order_relaxed))) {
211 return;
212 }
213 UnlockSlowPath(requester, state);
214}
215
216bool JSAtomicsMutex::IsHeld() {
217 return IsLockedField::decode(
218 AtomicStatePtr()->load(std::memory_order_relaxed));
219}
220
221bool JSAtomicsMutex::IsCurrentThreadOwner() {
222 bool result = AtomicOwnerThreadIdPtr()->load(std::memory_order_relaxed) ==
223 ThreadId::Current().ToInteger();
224 DCHECK_IMPLIES(result, IsHeld());
225 return result;
226}
227
228void JSAtomicsMutex::SetCurrentThreadAsOwner() {
229 AtomicOwnerThreadIdPtr()->store(ThreadId::Current().ToInteger(),
230 std::memory_order_relaxed);
231}
232
233void JSAtomicsMutex::ClearOwnerThread() {
234 AtomicOwnerThreadIdPtr()->store(ThreadId::Invalid().ToInteger(),
235 std::memory_order_relaxed);
236}
237
238std::atomic<int32_t>* JSAtomicsMutex::AtomicOwnerThreadIdPtr() {
239 int32_t* owner_thread_id_ptr =
240 reinterpret_cast<int32_t*>(field_address(kOwnerThreadIdOffset));
241 return base::AsAtomicPtr(owner_thread_id_ptr);
242}
